Work About

Columbus Idea Foundry Brand

The Brief

Client: Columbus Idea Foundry

Working with the Foundry's leadership, our goal was to communicate the Foundry's capacity to empower individuals to create whatever they can imagine with the resources and communal knowledge available.

The Logo

As the cornerstone of the Foundry's visual identity, the new logo was the first asset to be created. In addition to clarity of communication, versatility was a crucial concern for the logo. It was important to create a mark that could be fabricated with any of the tools available at the Foundry.

Initial logo drafts.

Initial iterations focused on imagery analagous to tools, manufacturing, physics, and electricity. Departing further, we explored imagery related to the concept of ideas.

Refined drafts exploring the lightbulb.

The second round of drafts was more abstract, to avoid imagery that would be too narrowly focused upon specific creative processes. These drafts attempted to communicate ideas and community at a more conceptual level.

The final logo.

The final logo takes off on the analogy of the lightbulb as the idea, while the hexagon represents hive-like community.

The final lockup.

The logo and wordmark lockup further emphasizes idea as a core component of the Foundry's mission.

Typography

The maker community values open-source, and so does the Columbus Idea Foundry. As such, in developing the type pallete, Source Sans Pro was selected as the workhorse, supplemented by League Gothic for emphasis.

Print Collateral

Evergreen print collateral was also developed as part of the new visual identity. I worked this through from concept through creation, including some contributions to the copy.

Postcard promotion encapsulating the Idea Foundry's mission.

Signage for events.

The final style guide in it's entirety can be viewed here.
